title: Carburetor
summary: A carburetor (American English)[1] or carburettor (British English)[2][3] is a device that mixes air and fuel for internal combustion engines in an appropriate airâ€“fuel ratio for combustion. The term is sometimes colloquially shortened to carb in the UK and North America or to carby in Australia.[4] To carburate or carburete (and thus carburation or carburetion, respectively) means to mix the air and fuel or to equip (an engine) with a carburetor for that purpose.
